com.squareup.picasso

Class Request.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.squareup.picasso.Request.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Request

    public static final class Request.Builder
extends Object
    Builder for creating Request instances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(int resourceId)
      Start building a request using the specified resource ID.
      Builder(android.net.Uri uri)
      Start building a request using the specified Uri.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Request build()
      Create the immutable Request object.
      Request.Builder centerCrop()
      Crops an image inside of the bounds specified by resize(int, int) rather than distorting the aspect ratio.
      Request.Builder centerInside()
      Centers an image inside of the bounds specified by resize(int, int).
      Request.Builder clearCenterCrop()
      Clear the center crop transformation flag, if set.
      Request.Builder clearCenterInside()
      Clear the center inside transformation flag, if set.
      Request.Builder clearOnlyScaleDown()
      Clear the onlyScaleUp flag, if set.
      Request.Builder clearResize()
      Clear the resize transformation, if any.
      Request.Builder clearRotation()
      Clear the rotation transformation, if any.
      Request.Builder config(android.graphics.Bitmap.Config config)
      Decode the image using the specified config.
      Request.Builder onlyScaleDown()
      Only resize an image if the original image size is bigger than the target size specified by resize(int, int).
      Request.Builder priority(Picasso.Priority priority)
      Execute request using the specified priority.
      Request.Builder resize(int targetWidth, int targetHeight)
      Resize the image to the specified size in pixels.
      Request.Builder rotate(float degrees)
      Rotate the image by the specified degrees.
      Request.Builder rotate(float degrees, float pivotX, float pivotY)
      Rotate the image by the specified degrees around a pivot point.

      Set the target image resource ID.
      Request.Builder setUri(android.net.Uri uri)
      Set the target image Uri.

      Set the stable key to be used instead of the URI or resource ID when caching.
      Request.Builder transform(List<? extends Transformation> transformations)
      Add a list of custom transformations to be applied to the image.
      Request.Builder transform(Transformation transformation)
      Add a custom transformation to be applied to the image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(android.net.Uri uri)
        Start building a request using the specified Uri.

      • Builder

        public Builder(int resourceId)
        Start building a request using the specified resource ID.

    • Method Detail

      • setUri

        public Request.Builder setUri(android.net.Uri uri)
        Set the target image Uri.

        This will clear an image resource ID if one is set.

      • setResourceId

        public Request.Builder setResourceId(int resourceId)
        Set the target image resource ID.

        This will clear an image Uri if one is set.

      • stableKey

        public Request.Builder stableKey(String stableKey)
        Set the stable key to be used instead of the URI or resource ID when caching. Two requests with the same value are considered to be for the same resource.

      • resize

        public Request.Builder resize(int targetWidth,
                              int targetHeight)
        Resize the image to the specified size in pixels. Use 0 as desired dimension to resize keeping aspect ratio.

      • clearResize

        public Request.Builder clearResize()
        Clear the resize transformation, if any. This will also clear center crop/inside if set.

      • centerCrop

        public Request.Builder centerCrop()
        Crops an image inside of the bounds specified by resize(int, int) rather than distorting the aspect ratio. This cropping technique scales the image so that it fills the requested bounds and then crops the extra.

      • clearCenterCrop

        public Request.Builder clearCenterCrop()
        Clear the center crop transformation flag, if set.

      • centerInside

        public Request.Builder centerInside()
        Centers an image inside of the bounds specified by resize(int, int). This scales the image so that both dimensions are equal to or less than the requested bounds.

      • clearCenterInside

        public Request.Builder clearCenterInside()
        Clear the center inside transformation flag, if set.

      • onlyScaleDown

        public Request.Builder onlyScaleDown()
        Only resize an image if the original image size is bigger than the target size specified by resize(int, int).

      • clearOnlyScaleDown

        public Request.Builder clearOnlyScaleDown()
        Clear the onlyScaleUp flag, if set.

      • rotate

        public Request.Builder rotate(float degrees)
        Rotate the image by the specified degrees.

      • rotate

        public Request.Builder rotate(float degrees,
                              float pivotX,
                              float pivotY)
        Rotate the image by the specified degrees around a pivot point.

      • clearRotation

        public Request.Builder clearRotation()
        Clear the rotation transformation, if any.

      • config

        public Request.Builder config(android.graphics.Bitmap.Config config)
        Decode the image using the specified config.

      • priority

        public Request.Builder priority(Picasso.Priority priority)
        Execute request using the specified priority.

      • transform

        public Request.Builder transform(Transformation transformation)
        Add a custom transformation to be applied to the image.

        Custom transformations will always be run after the built-in transformations.

      • transform

        public Request.Builder transform(List<? extends Transformation> transformations)
        Add a list of custom transformations to be applied to the image.

        Custom transformations will always be run after the built-in transformations.

      • build

        public Request build()
        Create the immutable Request object.
